array.string: Mariner 9: first to orbit another planet Mars
NASA's Mariner 9 beat the Soviet Mars 2—which had an 11-day head start—to Mars, becoming the first spacecraft to orbit another planet.
Skylab, USA’s first space station, is launched.
Saturn V rocket launched into space with an important mission: putting Skylab, the first US space station, into orbit.
After successfully negotiating the asteroid belt and a distance of 620 million miles, Pioneer 10 reached Jupiter and sent back to Earth the first close-up images of the spectacular gas giant.
Mariner 10 was an American robotic space probe launched by NASA , to fly by the planet Mercury.
Pioneer 11 first to passed by Saturne.
Pioneer 11 was the first human-made object to fly past Saturn and also returned the first pictures of the polar regions of Jupiter.
Sally Ride: the first American woman in space.
Sally Kristen Ride was an American astronaut and physicist. Born in Los Angeles, she joined NASA in 1978 and became the first American woman in space
